name: Tech Nottingham January 2018: The Tools Of Zapier & The Workplace Of The Future
description:
We have two great talks to kick off 2018 in style! Plus we've got free food and drinks provided at the event thanks to our sponsors Capital One, Cordius, Experian and MHR.

Everyone is welcome and there are no tickets required. Just turn up - it's free!

Full event details on our website

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Prometheus: Automated Outage Detection At Zapier - by Rob Golding


Zapier makes hundreds of millions of outbound API requests every day. When a service starts to fail, we need to know about it quickly so we can prevent our infrastructure from crawling to a halt. This talk explores the development of Prometheus, the tool we use to detect API issues at scale.

About Rob

Rob is a Senior Backend Engineer at Zapier, and previously led the team that developed the new Police.uk website.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Workplace Of The Future - by Mark Phelps

In this talk Mark discusses how more collaborative and mobile working is changing the face of the physical workspace and the effect it is having on human interactions.

About Mark

</a>

<a href="http://twitter.com/markp894">Mark Phelps is a seasoned Collaboration Specialist and Business Transformation professional with over 35 years' experience in the communications & cloud market. Starting his working life in the Royal Corps of Signals, he has enjoyed a varied and successful career as a Technical Innovator, Sales Specialist and Leader, and Consultant. Recently joining Node4 after 17 illustrious years at Cisco, he is proud to be leading the future direction of Node4's collaboration portfolio as Product Manager.

At work, Mark is a visionary strategist and has an avid passion for the use of technology to add tangible business value. He is also passionate about driving behavioural change and developing talent. At home, Mark is a keen snooker player and car enthusiast.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Win free JetBrains software at Tech Nottingham

This month at Tech Nottingham we'll be giving away a 1 year subscription to a JetBrains product of your choice, including Resharper, IntelliJ and PHPStorm.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Join in with the Nottingham Tech Community online 

Join our Slack group


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Full event details on our website
how_to_find_us: Grab a drink token from reception, head up the stairs and through the double doors! This venue is fully accessible.

name: TECH ON TOAST JANUARY 2018: INTRODUCTION TO ALEXA SKILLS

venue.name: Accelerate Places Nottingham
venue.address_1: The Poynt Building, 45 Wollaton Street, NG1 5FW

description:
We are delighted to announce that Steven Pears will be joining us for the first Tech on Toast of 2018 in January!

Get a free breakfast, hear some of Nottingham's brightest share their ideas and projects and socialise with the other members of the local tech community, all before you start your day.

Tech on Toast is free and there are no tickets required.

We'll be serving a range of breakfast options in a relaxed environment and all are welcome, regardless of technical background.

----------------

Get a free desk for the Day

Our venue, Accelerate Places, is offering free desk spaces to Tech on Toast guests! They are available from 9am to 5pm for the whole day following Tech on Toast.

----------------


Full event details can be found on the Tech Nottingham website here

----------------

INTRODUCTION TO ALEXA SKILLS

by Steven Pears
</a><a href="http://twitter.com/KrishBhasin">

In this talk we'll look into what makes up a skill that works with Amazon Echo and the Alexa assistant. We'll look at the configuration and code required to build a Skill using .NET Core, some tips to write a more usable skill, and the differences between when you're writing them for yourself and for your business.

ABOUT STEVEN

</a>

<a href="http://twitter.com/JessPWhite">

Steven has been enjoying .NET since the beta landed on his desk next to his folder full of MSDN CDs. Somehow maintaining gainful employment while at the same time loving regular expressions, working with local newspaper companies and construction software created a path that led him to Nottingham where he now works for Experian.

----------------


THE VENUE

Tech on Toast is held at the awesome Accelerate Places on Wollaton Street, near the Theatre Royal in Nottingham City Centre. With a top-notch cafe and amphitheatre style seating, it’s the perfect venue in which to spend your morning.

----------------


WHEN

This event starts from 7.30am on Wednesday 24th January 2018 - after that, it’s the fourth Wednesday of every month. We’ll see you there!

----------------


SPONSORED BY ESENDEX & REBEL RECRUITMENT

Full event details can be found on the Tech Nottingham website here

----------------


JOIN IN WITH THE NOTTINGHAM TECH COMMUNITY ONLINE

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/53428a5fe4b0fa0c16894821/t/58f5ff6d3a0411b4871c9cbf/1492516721375/?format=100w

The Tech Nottingham Slack group is a bustling chat community of Nottingham tech folk sharing ideas, jokes, stories and helping one another. We'd love for you to join in and be a part of it!

Join our Slack group

----------------
how_to_find_us: Go straight through the revolving door and up the steps - Breakfast awaits!
